Tasks and stimuli: Perceptual matching task
Mostly resting-state, some n-back, motion/stop signal, object localizer, language localizer, spatial-working memory localizer
Notes: Ground-truth test-bed for longitudinal stability of network metrics and multimodal phenotyping (openfmri.org)

Tasks and stimuli: Full-length Forrest Gump movie (+ audio-only & MEG extensions)
Notes: Rich audiovisual narrative with exhaustive annotations—ideal for cross-modal modelling (studyforrest.org)

Tasks and stimuli: 720 movie clips (400 actions)
Notes: lets you test spatiotemporal action models vs. cortex (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: 10 h audiobook stories
Notes: high-field language encoding/decoding benchmark (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: 1 400 object pictures × 4 tasks + MEG/behav
Notes: bridges object-vision nets and cross-modal concepts (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: 4 916 images drawn from COCO, ImageNet & SUN; rapid event-related design
Notes: Bridges computer-vision benchmarks and brain responses at large scale (Nature)

Tasks and stimuli: 50 + tasks spanning language, ToM, math, music, movie watching, retinotopy
tasks_list: working memory, inhibition, visual perception, face perception, attention, decision making, theory of mind, language comprehension, motor control, reward learning, spatial cognition, episodic memory, task shifting, planning, temporal cognition
Notes: Deep phenotyping across many cognitive domains at 1.5 mm voxels (Nature)

Tasks and stimuli: 3 s cinematic clips (9 000 trials)
Notes: fine-grained event boundaries; good for moment-level decoding (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: pRF/retinotopy sweeps
Notes: micron-level visual-field maps, useful as high-res localizer (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: 5 h rest + 5½ h task (motor, semantic, coherence & memory) per person
tasks_list: visual perception, face perception, language comprehension
Notes: Gold-standard for “precision fMRI” and estimating individual functional parcels (grattonlab.beckman.illinois.edu)

Tasks and stimuli: 24 k natural videos (8 categories)
Notes: complements NSD with video instead of stills (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: Passive listening to diverse, naturalistic audio narratives
Notes: Largest open dataset for language & discourse-level comprehension (Nature)

Tasks and stimuli: ~73 k unique natural photographs; 30–40 scan days per subject
Notes: Vision benchmark with order-of-magnitude more images than any prior fMRI set (naturalscenesdataset.org)

Tasks and stimuli: interactive video-game play, navigation, action observation
tasks_list: visual perception, navigation, action perception, sensorimotor coordination*
Notes: ties high-field imaging to embodied perception & RL models (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

Tasks and stimuli: Naturalistic movies & video-games, reading, mixed trial-based tasks; concurrent eye-tracking & physiology
tasks_list: visual perception, action perception, sensorimotor coordination*
Notes: Designed explicitly to train ANN models on dense, multimodal human data (Papers with Code)

Tasks and stimuli: 30 TV episodes + repeated clips
Notes: ultradense audiovisual time-series for encoding/decoding models (bioRxiv)

Tasks and stimuli: 101 different simple tasks
tasks_list: motor control, self monitoring, decision making, working memory, episodic memory, semantic memory, language comprehension, language production, reasoning, theory of mind, social cognition, empathy, face perception, visual perception, auditory perception, attention, spatial cognition, temporal cognition, arousal, appetitive motivation, learningRetry

Tasks and stimuli: Naturalistic videos, read or listen narratives, TOM, spatial cueing, memory, somatic and vicarious pain, mental rotation
tasks_list: visual perception, auditory perception, language comprehension, theory of mind, empathy

Tasks and stimuli: weekly rest, eyes-open movie, flanker
Notes: reliability/test–retest benchmark for pediatrics and network topology (FCON 1000)

Initiative: OpenNeuro ds002411 – “Program Comprehension & Expertise” (Ikutani et al., 2020)
Tasks and stimuli: • Categorise short Java functions into one of 4 semantic categories.• 72 snippets shown 3× (10 s code + 2 s fixation).

Initiative: “Computer-code comprehension shares neural resources with formal logic” (Liu et al., eLife 2020)
Tasks and stimuli: • Read real Python functions and answer forced-choice questions.• Read fake (lexically scrambled) code & memory-span control.• Separate localizers: symbolic logic, math, language, MSIT executive control.

Initiative: Comprehension of computer code relies primarily on domain-general executive brain regions

Tasks and stimuli: 160 classic psych experiments (? I'm counting 76) spanning logic, category learning, causal induction, economic games, etc.
Notes: Centaur fine-tunes an LLM on this dataset; the index of experiments is a ready-made long-tail task list (arXiv, marcelbinz.github.io)

Tasks and stimuli: Resting state, sensori-motor task, passive audio-visual task
tasks_list: visual perception, auditory perception, sensorimotor coordination*
Notes: Lifespan (18–88 y)

Tasks and stimuli: Numeric memory, Symbol-digit substitution, Trail-making, Fluid analogy, Reaction time
Notes: 100 k + subjects—huge normative baselines

Tasks and stimuli: 7 tasks: N-back WM, Monetary Gambling (MID), Motor localizer, Math & Story Language, Heider-Simmel Social, Relational reasoning, Facial Emotion
tasks_list: working memory, inhibition, decision making, language comprehension, theory of mind, empathy, face perception
Notes: Designed to sample “canonical” systems; publicly available stimuli & timing files (Human Connectome Project)

Tasks and stimuli: N-back, Stop-signal, Monetary Gambling
Notes: 11- to 16-year-olds; cross-sectional + longitudinal
